art.description:
Walk in the footsteps of the most famous lovers of all time! As their story unfolds through the majestic grounds of Montalvo, you'll be immersed in a 360 degree sphere of performance. We Players will blur the boundary between audience and actors, history and the present moment in this one-of-a-kind, site-integrated production.

Audiences will be on their feet, physically moving with the actors as the action unfolds throughout Montalvo’s landscape. Hear the clash of steel as sword fights fly on the Great Lawn; join the Capulets at their infamous masked ball in the historic Villa Montalvo; participate in the rituals of marriage and death in the Italianate Garden; and let Romeo and Juliet fill you with joy—and break your heart.

TICKET PRICES: General: $70 | Student: $40
http://montalvoarts.org/events/romeo_and_juliet_1009/facebook/
art.name: Romeo and Juliet

art.description:
9th Annual Luna Park Chalk Art Festival

Saturday, September 17, 2016
10AM to 5PM
Backesto Park – San José, California

Free to attend!
 
*Over 150 pieces of art chalked throughout the park
*Arts and crafts vendors
*Food trucks
*Live music
*Proceeds benefit K-12 arts programs in local schools

Now in it’s 9th year, the Luna Park Chalk Art Festival attracts over 3,000 artists, students, vendors, and community members for a colorful day in San José’s Backesto Park. Artists, students and chalk enthusiasts create over 150 pieces of diverse art throughout the park’s pathways, including original works, classical re­creations, traditional Italian madonarri street painting, 3D realistic works, cartoons, modern abstractions, and more. In addition to the artwork, the festival features a main stage of local musicians, dancers and performers, as well as local food trucks and vendor booths.

The Luna Park Chalk Art Festival and Luna Park Arts Foundation are 100% volunteer run.
Registration is NOW OPEN at chalkfest.lunaparkarts.org

Artists of all ages and experience levels can purchase a space to chalk at the festival. No experience is necessary!
-Chalk spaces come in various sizes and include soft pastels/chalk.
-K-12 School/youth programs may register for chalk spaces at no cost.
-Arts and crafts vendors, nonprofit organizations and businesses can purchase booth spaces and chalk art spaces.
-See the registration page for details and prices.
-Chalk spaces may be available to purchase the day of the event.

2016 Inspiring Artists (http://www.lunaparkarts.org/festival/inspiring-artists)

art.name: 2016 Luna Park Chalk Art Festival

art.description:
Art Explosion Fall Open Studios
Sept 23rd Friday 7-11pm
Sept 24&25 Sat & Sun 12-5pm

Art Explosion Studios, the Mission's largest Artist's collective is holding its annual Fall Open Studios on Sept 23-25. Come see over 100 artists as they open their studios to exhibit their work. Painters, sculptures, photographers, fashion designers and jewellers will be showing so there will be something for every type of art connoisseur. The free opening reception gala will be on Friday Sept 23rd from 7-11pm. Do not miss this opportunity to get a first look at all the incredible work that will be on display and enjoy a spectacular night out viewing art. In addition to artists opening their studios our galleries will be filled with art. On Sat & Sun we will have open studios from 12-5pm. Come meet the artists in their studios and get a personal showing of their art. As always Free Admission with plentiful street parking.
art.name: Art Explosion Fall Open Studios

art.description:
It's that time again! 

Every Second Sunday of the month we have FREE cultural arts activities happening within the 24th Street Latino Cultural District (24th Street and Mission to 24th Street and Potrero!)

Beginning this month,  those who attend and participate will recieve "Paseo Badges".  These will allow participants to redeem discounts and freebies from our participating neighborhood vendors and merchants! 

Schedule of Events: Sunday, 9/11/2016

10AM - 5 PM ● Lowriders and The Mission, Yesterday and Today
Alley Cat Gallery, 3036 24th Street 
Exhibition with original paintings by Anthony Holdsworth and photos by Lou Dematteis.

11AM-12:30 PM ● Bilingual Guided Mural Tour
Precita Eyes Murals, 2981 24th Street
Spanish & English guided mural tour through Balmy Alley and 24th Street Corridor. 

12-3 PM ●  Printing Class with tortilleras
Acción Latina, 2958 24th Street
Instructor: Veronica Solis , Hands on art class for the entire family!

3:30 - 6PM  ● Chapbook Reading
Adobe Books and Arts Cooperative, 3130 24th Street
Disorder Press presents Adam Soldofsky's debut chapbook of poetry titled "Memory Foam".

4-6:00 PM ● Gears Turning Poetry Series
Modern Times Bookstore, 2919 24th Street
Hosted by Kim Shuck; Poetry by QR Hand, Gail Mitchell, and Nellie Wong; Music by Ed Dang. 

5- 6:30 PM ● Cine+Mas SF Latino Film Screening 
Alley Cat Bookshop, 3036 24th Street 
Documentary Film: Cooking up Dreams Directed by: Ernesto Cabellos 
A journey into the kitchens of Peru's people -  locally, nationally, and internationally. 

5-7 PM ● DJ Night at Praxis 
Praxis, 3047 24th Street 
Live music, dancing, and performances. 

Discounts available only with a "Paseo Badge":

Dagwood and Scoops-- $2 scoop of Ice Cream
Temos Coffee--10% off all purchased items
Humphry Slocombe--First to arrive at paseo event are eligible for a free scoop
Praxis--10% off everything	
L’s Caffe--15% off on all lunch items
Luz De Luna--10% off everything, except on artwork and silver
Tio Chilos Restaurant--Spend $5 and get agua frescas for free
Mixcoatl--20% everything
art.name: Paseo Artistico: September 2016

art.description:
Join us at the Upload Collective for the second Art + VR Event on Tuesday, September 20th.

After such a great turn out at the last Art event at the Collective, we've decided to continue the series. Rather than just limiting the tech art to Virtual Reality, we have decided to include any art related to tech. This mission of bridging the gap between the tech world and the art world is a new mission that the H.E.art Project (The Home Endevor Art Project) has been born out of. This is a program designed to be funded by tech companies to help provide subsidized housing and gallery space to artists in the Bay Area, that are being pushed out due to gentrification, and thus keeping art within the city.

There will be an Art Talk followed by a presentation from Stuart Mason and his partner, Samuel Finn, discussing their vision for the H.E.art Project.

We will have a silent auction, virtual reality demos on Samsung Gear VRs,  HTC Vive experiences and art installations.

Food and drinks will be provided.

All proceeds go directly to H.E.art Project.

www.heartprojectsf.com
www.uploadvr.com

_______________________________

Partnership/ demo/ press inquiries: Olya@UploadVR.com, Ned@UploadVR.com
Art inquiries: Stuart@UploadVR.com
art.name: Art + VR Event
